intro: Pedicularis pyrenaica var. lasiocalyx, commonly known as the Pyrenean lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often at high altitudes. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with a distinctive spurred shape that attracts pollinators. The leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance.
